Summary Nirav’s successful tenure at Cisco spans experiences ranging from Catalyst Switching product development, Advanced (Professional) Services, Technical Services, and, Channel Sales.  
 
Currently, Nirav holds responsibilities for the entire Systems Engineering & GTM Strategy organization supporting the Cisco Channel Partner community in the Americas. Previously, in his time in Technical Services, Nirav built and ran TAC operations around the world with nearly 1000 engineers distributed across GEOs, and later was responsible for Service Delivery of Enterprise and SP Networking TAC across all Cisco customer segments; his organization enjoyed the highest CSAT scores for 2 consecutive years. 
 
Regarded as a highly entrepreneurial and collaborative leader, Nirav’s #1 priority is always investing in his people. 
 
Nirav holds his Bachelors from the University of Alabama-Birmingham, MBA from the Krannert School of Management at Purdue University, and, a Masters in International Affairs from the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts University. 
 
Prior to Cisco, Nirav was an entrepreneur in the lodging industry. He exhibits the unique ability to balance the development of high level strategy with ‘on the ground’ operational results blended with inspirational leadership and creative approaches to problem solving. 
 
Nirav has been profiled in a Duke/Fuqua School of Business Case Study, referenced by Forrester Research during their review of Cisco's approach to globalization, and, has been a guest lecturer for a Top 10 Business School in India. Experience Senior Director, (Sales) Systems Engineering & GTM Strategy, Americas Partner Organization Cisco September 2013  – Present (2 years) San Jose, CA Reporting directly to the SVP of the Americas Partner Organization within Americas Sales, Nirav Sheth is the Systems Engineering and Go To Market/Sales Strategy Leader for Cisco's AMER Channel Partner group. Through a team of 200+ employees across the US, Latin America, Canada and thousands of channel partners, Nirav's organization is responsible for partner enablement, helping partners enter new markets and practice areas while providing them with the support structure as they transform to deliver customer outcomes in the world of hybrid IT. With teams focusing across Cisco established architectures such as Enterprise Networks, Datacenter, Collaboration, as well as emerging solutions such as the Internet of Things, and Cloud, Nirav’s organization serves Cisco’s largest GEO region and those partners influence over $20B of revenue across product and service. Via his GTM/Sales Strategy teams, Nirav's organization is chartered with accelerating revenue opportunities, driving improved partner profitability programs, and, investing into new partner capabilities such as Big Data, OpenStack, SW lifecycle adoption, and other key Cisco priorities.
